read

public void read(int file,
                 int offset,
                 int size,
                 int address)
Moves size cells from the file identified by file starting from the file position specified by offset to the memory position specified by address. This method doesn't perform the transfer really: it only enqueues the requested operation, and the DMA's executes it on behalf of the OS.

Specified by:
read in interface DMA
Parameters:
file - the file from which move the cells.
offset - the file position from which to begin reading cells.
size - the number of cells to be moved.
address - the memory address where to store the cells.

write

public void write(int file,
                  int offset,
                  int size,
                  int address)
Moves size cells from the memory postion specified by address, to the file identified by file, starting from the file position offset. This method doesn't perform the transfer really: it only enqueues the requested operation, and the DMA's executes it on behalf of the OS.

Specified by:
write in interface DMA
Parameters:
file - the file to which store read cells.
offset - the file position to which to begin writing cells.
size - the number of cells to be moved.
address - the memory address where to begin reading cells.
